title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 2 points:

1 point: For indication that total energy is the sum of kinetic and potential energy

E = U(x) + K(x)

E = 4.0 x2 + 1 2 m(v(x))2

E = (4.0 J/m2)(-0.50 m)2 + 1 2 (3.0 kg)(2.0 m/s)2

1 point: For correct calculation of the numerical value of the total energy

E = 7.0 J
descriptions:
The response earns none of the following points:

1 point: For indication that total energy is the sum of kinetic and potential energy

E = U(x) + K(x)

E = 4.0 x2 + 1 2 m(v(x))2

E = (4.0 J/m2)(-0.50 m)2 + 1 2 (3.0 kg)(2.0 m/s)2

1 point: For correct calculation of the numerical value of the total energy

E = 7.0 J

The response earns one of the following points:

1 point: For indication that total energy is the sum of kinetic and potential energy

E = U(x) + K(x)

E = 4.0 x2 + 1 2 m(v(x))2

E = (4.0 J/m2)(-0.50 m)2 + 1 2 (3.0 kg)(2.0 m/s)2

1 point: For correct calculation of the numerical value of the total energy

E = 7.0 J

The response earns both of the following points:

1 point: For indication that total energy is the sum of kinetic and potential energy

E = U(x) + K(x)

E = 4.0 x2 + 1 2 m(v(x))2

E = (4.0 J/m2)(-0.50 m)2 + 1 2 (3.0 kg)(2.0 m/s)2

1 point: For correct calculation of the numerical value of the total energy

E = 7.0 J

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:

1 point: For indication that E = U when K = 0

E = U(x)

E = 4.0x2

1 point: For substitution of E from (a) into the equation

7.0 J = (4.0 J/m2)x2

x = ± 7.0 / 4.0 m

1 point: For including plus and minus signs in final numerical answers

x = ±1.3 m

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:

1 point: For clear indication that kinetic energy is total energy minus potential energy, using total energy from (a)
K = Etot - U

K = 7.0 J - (4.0 J/m2)(0.60 m)2 = 5.56 J

1 point: For using calculated K to solve for v

K = 1 2 mv2

5.56 J = 1 2 (3.0 kg)v2

v = 1.92 m/s

1 point: For substituting calculated value of v into expression for momentum

p = mv = (3.0 kg)(1.92 m/s) = 5.8 kg⋅m/s

Points could also be obtained by substituting the kinetic energy directly into the kinetic energy and momentum p = 2 m K

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:

1 point: For a correct relationship between force and potential energy (Point awarded for magnitude of acceleration)

F = − d U ( x ) d x

1 point: For an expression or calculated value for force consistent with relationship above

F = − ( d d x 4.0 x 2 ) = − 8.0 x

1 point: For application of Newton's second law using a derived expression or calculated value for force

a = F m = 8.0 x m

a = ( 8.0  kg/s 2 ) ( 0.60  m ) 3.0  kg

a = 1.6  m/s 2

Alternate Solution

E = U + K

1 point: For a correct energy relationship with potential and kinetic energy substituted

7 = 4x2 + ½ mv2

14 - 8x2 = mv2

1 point: For taking the derivative with respect to time of each side of this equation

−16x dx dt  =2mv dv dt

-16xv = 2mva

-8x = ma

1 point: For algebraically solving for acceleration

a=− 8x m

a = ( 8.0  kg/s 2 ) ( 0.60  m ) 3.0  kg

a = 1.6  m/s 2

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:

1 point: For a minimum of one complete cycle of a sine curve starting at the origin on the x versus t graph.

1 point: For a minimum of one complete cycle of a cosine squared curve starting at the maximum value on the K versus t graph.

1 point: For maxima and minima of the x graph matching the zeros of the K graph.
descriptions:
The response earns none of the following points:

1 point: For a minimum of one complete cycle of a sine curve starting at the origin on the x versus t graph.

1 point: For a minimum of one complete cycle of a cosine squared curve starting at the maximum value on the K versus t graph.

1 point: For maxima and minima of the x graph matching the zeros of the K graph.

The response earns one of the following points:

1 point: For a minimum of one complete cycle of a sine curve starting at the origin on the x versus t graph.

1 point: For a minimum of one complete cycle of a cosine squared curve starting at the maximum value on the K versus t graph.

1 point: For maxima and minima of the x graph matching the zeros of the K graph.

The response earns two of the following points:

1 point: For a minimum of one complete cycle of a sine curve starting at the origin on the x versus t graph.

1 point: For a minimum of one complete cycle of a cosine squared curve starting at the maximum value on the K versus t graph.

1 point: For maxima and minima of the x graph matching the zeros of the K graph.

The response earns all of the following points:

For a minimum of one complete cycle of a sine curve starting at the origin on the x versus t graph.

For a minimum of one complete cycle of a cosine squared curve starting at the maximum value on the K versus t graph.

For maxima and minima of the x graph matching the zeros of the K graph.

title: Units
stimulusHtml:
The response earns none of the following point:

1 point: For correct units on all completed nonzero numerical answers
descriptions:
The response can earn up to 1 point:

1 point: For correct units on all completed nonzero numerical answers

The response earns the following point:

1 point: For correct units on all completed nonzero numerical answers
